title: Easeout Weekly #23
body:
![Tower Testimonials](/images/uploads/tower_testimonials.png) [CMD+Z for Git is Here](https://css-tricks.com/cmdz-for-git-is-here/) One of Git’s greatest features is that it allows you to undo almost anything. However, it requires quite some experience to know how *exactly* to undo your *particular* kind of mess. Tower now allows you to undo virtually anything – simply by pressing CMD+Z! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/cmdz-for-git-is-here/)
![The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild](/images/uploads/zelda.png) [User onboarding lessons from The Legend of Zelda](https://uxdesign.cc/user-onboarding-lessons-from-the-legend-of-zelda-breath-of-the-wild-8d22abec8342) Video games have been onboarding users for a long time, since the 80s to be exact. By designing product onboardings more like video games, we force ourselves to deliver a better experience through the journey, instead of focusing on the destination. [Read it ➡️](https://uxdesign.cc/user-onboarding-lessons-from-the-legend-of-zelda-breath-of-the-wild-8d22abec8342)
![Porsche 911 Sketched](/images/uploads/porsche-final-sketch-tutorial-part-1.png) [How To Create A Porsche 911 With Sketch (Part 1)](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/porsche-911-sketch-tutorial-part-1/) This tutorial is for illustrators who also happen to be passionate car enthusiasts. If you follow along, you will learn how to draw from scratch in Sketch the legendary Porsche 911 — all in vectors. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/porsche-911-sketch-tutorial-part-1/)
![Styled-Components In React](/images/uploads/styled-components.png) [How To Use Styled-Components In React](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/styled-components-react/) In this tutorial, we'll learn about managing our styles in a component-specific manner, otherwise knows as CSS-in-JS. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/styled-components-react/)
![Calendar Monthly View](/images/uploads/calendar-month-view-previous-past-months.png) [How to Make a Monthly Calendar With Real Data](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-make-a-monthly-calendar-with-real-data/) Making a calendar is actually a lot more straightforward than you might think, and only requires the trifecta of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-make-a-monthly-calendar-with-real-data/)
![Electron And Vue](/images/uploads/electron-and-vuejs.png) [Building Desktop Apps With Electron And Vue](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/desktop-apps-electron-vue-javascript/) In this tutorial, Timi Omoyeni explains what you need to keep in mind when building a desktop application with Vue.js using the Vue CLI Plugin Electron Builder. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/desktop-apps-electron-vue-javascript/)
![Safari Logo](/images/uploads/safari-logo.jpg) [Apple declined to implement 16 Web APIs in Safari due to privacy concerns](https://www.zdnet.com/article/apple-declined-to-implement-16-web-apis-in-safari-due-to-privacy-concerns/) Apple said this week that it declined to implement 16 new web technologies (Web APIs) in Safari because they posed a threat to user privacy by opening new avenues for user fingerprinting. [Read it ➡️](https://www.zdnet.com/article/apple-declined-to-implement-16-web-apis-in-safari-due-to-privacy-concerns/)
![Audio Player Wireframes](/images/uploads/audio-player-controls-screenshot-image.png) [Translating Design Wireframes Into Accessible HTML/CSS](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/design-wireframes-accessible-html-css/) In this article, Harris will walk you through the process of analyzing a wireframe from an accessibility perspective and making coding decisions to optimize for accessibility in both design and development phases. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/design-wireframes-accessible-html-css/)
![Remote work is a platform article screenshot](/images/uploads/remote-work-platform.png) [Remote work is a platform](https://m.signalvnoise.com/remote-work-is-a-platform/) In-office and remote work are different platforms of work. And right now, what we’re seeing a lot of companies attempt to port local work methods to working remotely. [Read it ➡️](https://m.signalvnoise.com/remote-work-is-a-platform/)
![Inline block use cases](/images/uploads/inline-block.png) [When do you use inline-block?](https://css-tricks.com/when-do-you-use-inline-block/) What is it 'inline-block' actually useful for? When do you pick it over other, perhaps similar, options? [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/when-do-you-use-inline-block/)
![Chakra UI And Nuxt.js](/images/uploads/chakra-front-end-app.png) [How To Build An Accessible Front-End Application With Chakra UI And Nuxt.js](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/accessible-front-end-application-chakra-ui-nuxtjs/) In this article, we are going to be looking at how to use Chakra UI and NuxtJS in building accessible front-end applications. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/accessible-front-end-application-chakra-ui-nuxtjs/)
![Gatsby Site with WordPress Data](/images/uploads/gatsby-wordpress.png) [Creating a Gatsby Site with WordPress Data](https://newsakmi.com/news/tech-news/software/creating-a-gatsby-site-with-wordpress-data/) Gatsby, a React-based framework for static sites, is attracting attention not only from JavaScript developers but also from the WordPress developers and users. This tutorial takes you through the setup! [Read it ➡️](https://newsakmi.com/news/tech-news/software/creating-a-gatsby-site-with-wordpress-data/)

short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
